body_html:
I've got a helpful feedback on reddit. It seems that this LSTM size is unusually small (only seven inputs).

If input_dim is set to 300, and config is not used (eager does seem to respect intra_op_parallelism_threads and inter_op_parallelism_threads), CPU time is comparable.
body_text:
I've got a helpful feedback on reddit. It seems that this LSTM size is unusually small (only seven inputs).
If input_dim is set to 300, and config is not used (eager does seem to respect intra_op_parallelism_threads and inter_op_parallelism_threads), CPU time is comparable.
body:
I've got a helpful [feedback](https://www.reddit.com/r/MachineLearning/comments/7p057n/d_are_lstms_in_pytorch_3_times_slower_than_in/) on reddit. It seems that this LSTM size is unusually small (only seven inputs).

If `input_dim` is set to 300, and config is not used (eager does seem to respect `intra_op_parallelism_threads` and `inter_op_parallelism_threads`), CPU time is comparable.
